identificationModule.briefTitle: AdheRence to Inhaled Corticosteroids in Asthma
identificationModule.officialTitle: AdheRence to Inhaled Corticosteroids in Asthma

descriptionModule.briefSummary: It is widely recognized that asthma in adult African American patients is a significant health problem, which is partly affected by relatively low inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) adherence rates. The goal of this study is to pilot test an ICS adherence intervention, ARICA, that aims to improve ICS adherence in adult African Americans.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The investigators will evaluate ARICA in Duke primary care clinics to study its feasibility and acceptability using a quasi-experimental pre-post study design. The study will enroll between 32 and 48 adult African Americans with persistent asthma and suboptimal ICS adherence, and their health care providers, to study the use of the intervention and key indicators of the intervention's potential effectiveness.

armGroups.label: Control (Group 1)
armGroups.description: This group is considered the control group. This group will have scheduled texts and emails for the monthly surveys after the participant completes the baseline questionnaires.

armGroups.label: ARICA Intervention (Group 2)
armGroups.description: This group is considered the intervention group. Participants in this group will receive weekly texts and emails containing asthma facts and myths. They will also complete monthly surveys and participate in asthma education sessions.

interventions.name: ARICA
interventions.description: Personalized ARICA (AdheRence to Inhaled Corticosteroids in Asthma) intervention package.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported Experiences With the ARICA Program
primaryOutcomes.description: Assessment of participants experiences with and perceptions of the ARICA program, as assessed by in-depth semi-structured qualitative interview.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Patient Reported Medication Adherence as Measured by the DOSE-Nonadherence (Voils) Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: patients' medication adherence rates based on Voils adherence questionnaire adherence questionnaire. Difference from baseline to follow up. Scored 0-4, higher is more non-adherent

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Asthma Control as Measured by the Asthma Control Test
secondaryOutcomes.description: patient reported difference from baseline to follow up. Higher score is better asthma control. Range 5-25.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Asthma-Related Quality of Life as Measured by the Marks Asthma-Related Quality of Life Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patient reported. Difference from baseline to follow up. Range 0-80, higher score means greater impact of asthma on quality of life.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria

* At least 18 years of age
* Self-identifying African American
* Self-reported current asthma
* Prescribed an inhaled corticosteroid (alone or combination) for ≥ 1 month
* Presented at a Duke Primary Care clinic visit within the past 3 years or is establishing care at Duke Primary Care
* Follow up Duke Primary Care visit within the next 6 months

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unable or unwilling to provide informed consent
